headline.main: BRETT VIEWS LIBYA AS U.S. PLANE TEST; General Asserts Replacements From America Are Likely if Fighting Is Prolonged CLAIMS EDGE IN COMBATS Observer Says British Pilots Prefer Our Machines -- Urges Greater Standardization

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Nov. 21 -- Major Gen. George H. Brett of the United States Army Air Corps said in an interview today that there is a large number of American-built planes operating in the Middle East and that "a great deal of pressure is being brought to bear on supply activities" in the United States to insure that the Middle East sectors are being "very well taken care of."
abstract: U S plane performance in Middle East praised by Maj Gen G H Brett

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
